title: RNA virus
summary: An RNA virus is a virus which has (ribonucleic acid) RNA as its genetic material.[1] The nucleic acid is usually single-stranded RNA (ssRNA) but it  may be double-stranded RNA (dsRNA).[2] Notable human diseases caused by RNA viruses include the common cold, influenza, SARS, MERS, COVID-19, Dengue Virus, hepatitis C, hepatitis E, West Nile fever, Ebola virus disease, rabies, polio, mumps, and measles.
